title: Britain's ex-prince Andrew arrested over misconduct amid Epstein row
content: Britain's Prince ex-Andrew has been arrested. He faces suspicion of misconduct in public office. This marks a significant development. The Duke of York has been living in Norfolk. Thames Valley Police confirmed the arrest. Searches are underway at multiple locations. The investigation is active. Prince Andrew has previously denied wrongdoing.

title: How AI uncovered Rs 70,000 crore tax evasion scam starting with Hyderabad biryani chains
content: An Income Tax investigation into Hyderabad biryani chains uncovered a massive tax evasion scam across India's food and beverage industry. Analyzing 60 terabytes of data from a pan-India billing software, officials revealed suppressed sales turnover of at least Rs 70,000 crore since 2019-20. The probe identified deletion and under-reporting of cash transactions as key evasion tactics.

title: Nifty50 ends below 25,500; BSE Sensex down over 1,200 points - top reasons for fall
content: Stock market crash today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex tanked in trade on Thursday after three consecutive days of gains. While Nifty50 went below 25,450, BSE Sensex crashed over 1,400 points in intraday trade.

title: Thala for a reason? Shivam Dube credits 'Mahi bhai' after match-winning knock
content: Shivam Dube credited MS Dhoni's guidance for his improved batting approach, particularly against pace. Dhoni advised focusing on strike rotation and controlled intent, which Dube implemented effectively in India's T20 World Cup win against the Netherlands. Dube's match-winning 67-run knock and two wickets earned him player of the match honors.

title: 'Who will pay for it?': SC raps Tamil Nadu govt for promising free electricity
content: The Supreme Court has criticized the Tamil Nadu electricity board's promise of free electricity to all consumers. The apex court expressed concern that such freebies, regardless of financial need, hinder national economic development. It noted that states often offer these schemes, funded by taxpayer money, without proper budgetary justification.

title: US is planning to launch website that may make governments across Europe quite angry
content: The US government is reportedly planning to launch a website, freedom.gov, to display content banned by foreign governments, including alleged hate speech and terrorist propaganda. This initiative, led by Undersecretary Sarah Rogers, could strain relations with European allies and be perceived as an attempt to undermine national laws, despite past US efforts to promote free information access globally.

title: Bangladesh skies closed for SpiceJet: Here's why airline is barred by Dhaka
content: Bangladesh has barred SpiceJet from its airspace over unpaid dues, forcing the airline to reroute flights from Kolkata to northeastern cities like Guwahati.  While SpiceJet assures constructive engagement for resolution, the extended flight paths are impacting operations. This comes as the budget carrier recently reported a significant quarterly loss.

title: ‚ÄòExpectations weighing him down‚Äô: Gavaskar reveals how Abhishek can survive T20 WC test
content: Cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar believes pressure is affecting India's young opening batter Abhishek Sharma's T20 World Cup form, advising him to build his innings patiently rather than forcing big shots early.  He also praised Shivam Dube's explosive batting and highlighted Varun Chakravarthy's crucial role as a key bowler for India.

title: Rajasthan: Man detained for threatening to 'shoot' Rahul Gandhi & 25 other Congress MPs
content: A man identifying as a Karni Sena spokesperson was detained in Kota for allegedly uploading a video threatening to shoot Rahul Gandhi and 25 other Congress MPs. The threats were issued over alleged verbal abuse of Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla. Both BJP and Karni Sena have denied any association with the accused.

title: Explained: What is India‚Äôs Sarvam AI model that Google CEO Sundar Pichai is impressed with
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai lauded Sarvam AI for its groundbreaking work in developing AI models tailored for Indian languages and contexts. The startup's AI reportedly outperforms major global models like Gemini and ChatGPT in specific benchmarks, showcasing advanced capabilities in visual understanding and document analysis for India's diverse linguistic landscape.

title: Deadly thread in the sky: Why Chinese manjha remains a killer
content: Chinese manjha, a sharp synthetic kite string, poses a deadly threat during Indian festivals, causing severe injuries and fatalities to motorcyclists and birds. Despite government bans and enforcement drives, its illegal sale persists, turning a cherished tradition into a recurring public safety crisis.

title: At AI Summit, PM Modi‚Äôs nameplate carries a ‚ÄòBharat‚Äô message
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi urged the global community at the AI Impact Summit to leverage technological disruption as humanity's greatest opportunity, emphasizing "right action" guided by "right understanding." The summit also saw the country's nameplate displayed as "Bharat," a recurring practice at official global events, sparking renewed discussion.

title: As Anthropic and Pentagon cannot stop fighting, here's who said what
content: AI giant Anthropic is in a dispute with the US Department of Defense over the deployment of its AI models. The Pentagon insists on unrestricted lawful use, while Anthropic seeks assurances against autonomous weapons and domestic spying. This disagreement could impact Anthropic's $200 million contract and its position as the sole AI provider on classified military networks.

title: From Gerald R Ford to INS Vikramaditya: A look at the world‚Äôs 10 biggest aircraft carriers
content: Aircraft carriers are powerful mobile airbases crucial for naval strategy, projecting power, and supporting diverse missions. From the technologically advanced USS Gerald R. Ford to the UK's Queen Elizabeth-class and Russia's Admiral Kuznetsov, these vessels showcase global naval capabilities and evolving designs.

title: Gold price today: Check rates of 18K, 22K and 24K gold in your city
content: Gold prices saw an upward trend on Thursday, with the April futures contract climbing Rs 365 to Rs 1,56,126 per 10 grams. This rise was fueled by fresh speculator buying and strong spot demand. Globally, New York gold futures also gained, reflecting a positive market sentiment.

title: Karachi gas explosion: 16 dead, several injured after illegal building collapse
content: A devastating gas explosion ripped through a residential building in Karachi's Soldier Bazaar early this morning, claiming at least 16 lives, including women and children. The blast caused a partial collapse of the ground-plus-two-storey structure, trapping victims under debris. Rescue efforts are underway, with authorities investigating the cause of the tragedy amidst ongoing concerns about building safety in the city.

title: Intruder breaks into Bengaluru home, slits woman‚Äôs throat as husband sleeps beside her
content: A 70-year-old woman was brutally murdered in her Bengaluru home while her mentally challenged husband lay beside her. Police arrested a wholesale shop owner, Shivakumar, alleging financial distress as the motive for the attack. Investigators believe the suspect sought gold ornaments and cash. CCTV footage and vehicle tracing led to the arrest.

title: 'India used to fear us': Pakistan's Amir, Ali blast Shadab for digs at seniors
content: Mohammad Amir said Pakistan no longer commands the fear it did in the 1990s, especially against India. Shahid Afridi called for dropping senior players, which angered Shadab Khan, who reminded critics they also never beat India in World Cups. Basit Ali criticised Shadab‚Äôs comments and questioned his performances, sharing an anecdote about taking away his phones on a past tour.

title: Freed of murder charges after 43 yrs, why is Indian-origin man still not free in US?
content: An Indian-origin man, exonerated after 43 years in prison for a murder conviction overturned due to withheld evidence, now faces deportation. Despite his release from state prison, he was immediately taken into federal immigration custody, with bail denied due to a decades-old minor drug felony.

title: Abrahamic vs Islamic blocs: How India and Pakistan are reshaping UAE-Saudi split
content: Saudi Arabia and the UAE, once close allies, are now locked in open rivalry, impacting the Yemen war, cross-border trade, and regional flashpoints. This strategic split challenges core assumptions about Gulf stability and investor confidence. The dispute, fueled by economic competition and differing regional visions, is escalating with potential for proxy conflicts and business friction.

title: TCS-OpenAI Strategic Alliance: Tata Group IT major to build 100MW AI facility
content: Tata Consultancy Services has partnered with OpenAI to build AI infrastructure in India, aiming to enhance productivity and innovation. The collaboration will leverage OpenAI's enterprise ChatGPT and Codex tools, with TCS developing AI-ready, green energy-powered data centers. This strategic alliance seeks to position India as a global AI hub and empower its youth for the AI era.

title: T20 World Cup: Albie vs Morne Morkel alongside India vs South Africa in Super Eight
content: South Africa's specialist consultant Albie Morkel lightened the mood ahead of their UAE clash, joking about his brother Morne's role with India.  Albie's focus on yorkers and building confidence has bolstered the Proteas' formidable pace attack, with bowlers like Lungi Ngidi and Marco Jansen excelling.  He credits Stephen Fleming for shaping his player-centric coaching approach.

title: Now, domestic violence legal in Taliban-led Afghanistan ‚Äî as long as no ‚Äòbroken bones, open wounds‚Äô
content: Afghanistan's new penal code, signed by the Taliban's supreme leader, permits husbands to physically abuse wives and children without causing severe injury. It formalizes inequality, with different penalties for 'free' individuals and 'slaves.' Psychological and sexual violence against women are not explicitly prohibited, leaving them vulnerable and without adequate legal recourse.

title: T20 WC: Full Super 8 schedule with match timings and venues
content: The T20 World Cup 2026 Super 8 stage is set with India, Pakistan, Sri Lanka, Zimbabwe, England, West Indies, New Zealand and South Africa qualifying. India topped Group A, while Australia were eliminated. The teams are split into two Super 8 groups, with fixtures across India and Sri Lanka from February 21 to March 1. The top two teams from each group will reach the semi-finals.

title: ‚ÄòAsked for details of pending dues‚Äô: Lucknow woman slaps, assaults electricity department employees
content: A woman allegedly stormed a Lucknow power substation, assaulting staff and tearing documents after her home's electricity was disconnected. Nidhi Sharma reportedly became agitated when asked for account details, leading to a physical altercation where employees were injured. Police have registered an FIR and are investigating.

title: 'Can I get a Shiv Shambhu?': Grammy winner SZA‚Äôs viral Mahashivratri moment at Isha Yoga Center
content: Grammy-winning artist SZA recently embarked on a personal spiritual journey in India, seeking stillness and balance beyond her demanding global career. Her visit included a silent retreat and participation in Mahashivratri at the Isha Yoga Center, showcasing a deep dive into mindfulness and cultural immersion.

title: 'Had knives, petrol, chainsaw': Techie held grudge against pregnant ex-wife, gored her to death
content: A 29-year-old software professional was allegedly murdered by her former husband inside her Hyderabad apartment. The accused, who had previously lived in Canada, was apprehended after a standoff where he threatened to set the room on fire. The victim had divorced him last year and filed a domestic violence case.

title: Mukesh Ambani says Jio, RIL to invest Rs 10L cr on AI; believes AI won‚Äôt kill jobs
content: Speaking to attendees, Mukesh Ambani conveyed optimism that AI would broaden economic prospects instead of diminishing them. He maintained that fears surrounding large-scale job losses are misplaced

title: Ranji Trophy: J&K dare to dream under pressure ‚Äì A big leap long in the making
content: Jammu and Kashmir's remarkable journey to the Ranji Trophy final, marked by self-belief and meticulous planning, has transformed them into title contenders. Coach Ajay Sharma's patient approach and the development of a core group of talented young players, supported by improved infrastructure and pre-season exposure, have been pivotal to this success.

title: Income Tax notice alert! Senior execs with over Rs 50L salary under radar - Here's why
content: In many instances, the taxpayers are alleged to have sought tax relief by reporting bogus donations to religious bodies, charitable organisations, or educational institutions.

title: Relief for Honey Rose: High Court cancels GST notice against the 'Rachel' actress
content: The Kerala High Court has quashed a GST notice demanding Honey Rose's tax records for multiple years in one go, stating separate requests are necessary. Meanwhile, her upcoming film 'Rachel', where she plays a butcher, has been postponed again, with makers citing release landscape concerns for a better audience experience.

title: T20 World Cup: India's worrying batting patterns and struggles vs off-spin
content: India have won all four group-stage matches at the T20 World Cup, but cracks have emerged, particularly against off-spin in the middle overs. Fixed batting roles and slow scoring by Suryakumar Yadav and Tilak Varma have hurt momentum, giving opponents a clear blueprint. Rivals like South Africa will target this weakness, and India must urgently address their middle-overs approach ahead of the Super Eights.

title: Ex-South Korea president Yoon sentenced to life imprisonment for 'insurrection'
content: Former South Korean President Yoon Suk Yeol received a life sentence for insurrection after declaring martial law in December 2024, a move the court deemed a plot to paralyze the National Assembly. The declaration, though brief and without casualties, led to his impeachment and subsequent trials. Two cabinet members also faced convictions in related cases.

title: ‚ÄòCultural insensitivity‚Äô: Mamata slams PM Modi over ‚ÄòSwami‚Äô prefix to Ramakrishna‚Äôs name
content: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for using the prefix 'Swami' for Sri Sri Ramakrishna Paramahamsadeva on his birth anniversary. Banerjee stated this displayed cultural insensitivity, as the saint was revered as 'Thakur,' with 'Swami' being a title for his disciples. Modi had earlier paid tributes to Swami Ramakrishna Paramahansa.

title: AI summit: Tata Sons' chair's expansion pitch, Google CEO‚Äôs ‚Äòvision‚Äô ‚Äî who said what
content: India is hosting the India-AI Impact Summit 2026, bringing together global leaders to discuss artificial intelligence. Discussions focused on democratizing AI, building sovereign capabilities, and ensuring inclusive growth. Leaders emphasized AI's transformative potential across sectors like healthcare and education. The summit highlighted India's growing role as a trusted AI hub in the Global South.

title: DMDK joins DMK-led alliance for Tamil Nadu polls; Premallatha Vijayakant meets Stalin
content: DMDK has officially joined the DMK alliance, marking its first partnership with the party since its inception in 2005. General secretary Premallatha Vijayakant confirmed the decision after meeting with Chief Minister M.K. Stalin. Seat-sharing discussions are ongoing, with a Rajya Sabha seat anticipated for DMDK.

title: Chatfishing: Is AI creeping into your dating life? Here's how to fix it
content: Online dating is facing a new challenge: chatfishing, where AI crafts messages for users. This trend, supported by studies, makes connections feel superficial and heartbreak harder to detect.  Experts advise quick transitions to voice or video calls to verify authenticity and prevent emotional deception.

title: India vs SA: ‚ÄòBaby AB‚Äô Dewald Brevis unfazed by Varun Chakravarthy threat
content: India and South Africa gear up for a T20 World Cup Super 8 clash, with a key battle potentially involving Varun Chakravarthy and Dewald Brevis.  Dubbed 'Baby AB', Brevis, unfazed by the spinner, aims to leverage his IPL experience.  He showed glimpses of form against UAE, emphasising positivity and backing his game.

title: ‚ÄòGive AI an open sky, but ...‚Äô: PM Modi hails AI, flags caution ‚Äî top quotes
content: Prime Minister Modi emphasized democratizing AI for human-centric development at the AI Impact Summit. He highlighted India's talent and policy clarity, inviting global collaboration. Modi unveiled the MANAV Vision for ethical, accountable, and inclusive AI, stressing the need for global standards and child safety in the evolving digital landscape.

title: Why a far-Left French MP is under-fire for a nationalist's death
content: Arnault himself is not accused of involvement in the violence. He has stated that he initiated procedures to dismiss a staff member following the arrest and said he would cooperate fully with investigators.

title: Shirtless, Blindfolded: Disturbing Video Emerges Of 2024 'Hazing' Session
content: Fresh details about a hazing incident that took place at the University of Iowa in November 2024 have emerged, courtesy of police body camera footage.

title: Galgotias Rep Neha Singh's "Open To Work" LinkedIn Pic Viral After Robot Row
content: Galgotias University's Neha Singh is under fire for showcasing a Chinese robotic dog at the India AI Impact Summit, claiming it was developed by her educational institution.

title: Opinion: Opinion | Trump Might Not Actually Have A 'Real' Plan For Iran
content: Sure, the US is very capable of another military-driven 'hit-and-run', this time in Iran. But the question would remain, to what end?

title: F-22 Raptors, F-35 Lightnings: US Unleashes Massive Air Armada, Iran Watches
content: The US military has assembled the greatest amount of air power in the Middle East since the 2003 invasion of Iraq by sending significant numbers of cutting-edge F-35 and F-22 jet fighters and support aircraft to the region.

title: Opinion: Opinion: Tim Cook Seems Determined To Keep Bruising Apple
content: For 13 years running, the iPhone maker has been the world's most valuable brand as measured by the consulting firm Interbrand.

title: How A 2020 Tremor Through Central Asia Unmasked China's Nuclear Secrets
content: A small tremor rippled through a remote corner of Central Asia in June 2020. It registered at 2.75 on the seismic scale. The signal was picked up by a monitoring station in Kazakhstan operated by the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty Organisation

title: Sam Altman, At Delhi Summit, Shares One Thing He Agrees With Others On AI
content: If there is one consensus from the massively successful India AI Impact Summit 2026 held in Delhi, it would be the call for regulation of artificial intelligence. The latest to endorse this view is ChatGPT-maker OpenAI's chief Sam Altman.

title: Supriya Sule's Security Request For Nephew After Ajit Pawar's Death In Plane Crash
content: Supriya Sule on Thursday demanded that the Maharashtra government provide security to her party MLA Rohit Pawar, noting that he has been raising concerns and questions in the wake of Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar's death in an air crash.

title: British Couple, Arrested For Espionage During World Tour, Jailed For 10 Years
content: A British couple detained in Iran since January 2025 have been sentenced to 10 years in jail for espionage, their family announced on Thursday, prompting condemnation from the UK government.

title: 16 Killed In Building Collapse After Gas Cylinder Blast In Pak's Karachi
content: A gas explosion ripped through an apartment building in Pakistan's largest port city of Karachi on Thursday, killing at least 16 people, including women and children, and injuring several others after part of the structure collapsed.

title: Kim Jong Un Behind The Wheels Of Rocket Launcher In North Korea Nuclear Flex
content: North Korean leader Kim Jong Un reportedly took a nuclear-capable multiple rocket launcher for a stroll on the roads of the capital, Pyongyang.

title: Maharashtra Woman Appears For Class 12 Exam With Her 10-Day-Old Baby
content: A woman carried her 10-day-old baby while appearing for her Class 12 Maharashtra board examination in Nanded city, prompting authorities to set up a special mother-friendly facility at the exam centre, officials said.

title: Ex-South Korean President Gets Life Sentence For Imposing Martial Law
content: A South Korean court sentenced ex-president Yoon Suk Yeol to life in prison, finding him guilty of leading an insurrection when he abruptly declared martial law in 2024.

title: Give Perks To Women Marrying Farmers: Karnataka MLA Writes To Siddaramaiah
content: Farmer groups in Karnataka in the past have alleged that many young men engaged in agriculture are struggling to find brides.

title: Check-In Disruptions At Delhi, Other Airports Due To Software Glitch
content: Airlines, including IndiGo, Air India Express, SpiceJet, and Akasa Air experienced temporary check-in disruptions at multiple airports, including Delhi and Mumbai, on Thursday morning following a technical issue.

title: On CCTV, Stray Dogs Attack Karnataka Girl, 6. She Suffers Severe Eye Injury
content: A six-year-old girl was brutally injured after being attacked by a pack of dogs in Karnataka's Vijayapura district on Wednesday morning. The girl, identified as Anvita Mallikarjuna Shetty, has suffered injuries to her left eye.

title: Adani Group Announces Scholarships For Young Talent At India's Top Business Schools
content: The Adani Group has announced 24 fully-funded scholarships for students at India's leading business schools under the 2025-27 cohort of the Adani Accelerated Leadership Programme (AALP).

title: Punjab Woman, 99, Robbed, Killed, Body Found Inside Iron Trunk
content: A 99-year-old woman was murdered by a robber who stuffed her body inside an iron trunk in her house in a village here, police said on Thursday.

title: Water Tragedy Rocks Madhya Pradesh Assembly, Minister Admits 22 Deaths, Opposition Disagrees
content: The deaths linked to contaminated water in Indore's Bhagirathpura area sparked intense uproar in the Madhya Pradesh Assembly after discrepancies emerged between the government's written reply and statements made during the debate.

title: Video: Priest, Unwell, Vomits On Taiwan President At Event
content: The incident occurred on the second day of the Lunar New Year at the Sacrificial Rites Martial Temple, where Taiwan President Lai Ching-te was attending traditional festivities.

title: What do Barcelona need in transfer market?
content: 2-1 defeat at Girona puts them two points clear at the top of the laLiga . real madrid beat swansea 2-1 on the road . adam lallana's side have lost their last two games in the premier league .

title: How to bet the Genesis Invitational: What to look for in the return to Riviera
content: the Genesis Invitational is back at Riviera Country Club after last year's detour to Torrey Pines . I'm targeting players who can create birdie looks with approach shots, save themselves when they miss the greens and actually capitalize on momentum . most top 20s are juiced, and I rarely step into Top 10 unless there is a real ceiling case .

title: Olympic men's hockey daily: Semifinal matchups are set
content: three out of four quarterfinal matchups in the 2026 Olympic men's hockey tournament went to overtime . the top four seeds all move on, with both semifinal games scheduled for Friday . no. 1 seed Canada vs. No. 4 seed Finland, 10:40 a.m. OT winner sends U.S. into hockey semis .

title: 'I'd rather retire': Caitlin Clark reacts to LeBron James giving up cookies and wine
content: leBron James says he just wants to live and doesn't know if he'll play for a 24th season . the los Angeles lakers star said he would abstain from desserts and alcohol altogether . he revealed that once the month ended, he decided to continue the fast through December .

title: Bubble Watch: Texas A&M's comeback win keeps tournament hopes alive
content: teams have roughly four weeks until selection Sunday to strengthen their cases . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate teams' underlying potential .

title: Canada sharpens skilled immigration system, unveils new Express Entry categories for 2026
